result.execSummary:
The defendant Hailey N. Heisler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hailey N. Heisler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hailey N. Heisler was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
12 mo. DPA - Upon successful completion, Ct. 1 amended to ordinance of DC & defendant will enter NC plea w/forfeiture of $25 plus costs.  Ct. 2 & uncharged read-in 15FL651 to be dismissed.  Conditions:
1)  No new criminal offences; 2) Notify DA's Office & Clerk of Courts of any change of address/phone number within 48 hours; 3) Comply with all terms of diversion supervision & report to Diversion Coordinator on the 1st Wednesday of each month; 4) Pay supervision fees of $25/mo to DA's Office; 5) No contact with C.P.; 6) Make reasonable efforts to locate/maintain full time employment/education & provide documentation to Diversion Coordinator; 7) Continue to attend school to obtain high school diploma during agreement.  In addition, defendant to avoid unexcused absences and/or tardies from school; 8) Complete 40 hours Community Service & provide documentation; 9) Undergo Anger Management evaluation within 90 days & any follow-up counseling/treatment required.  Defendant to attened all scheduled appointments & comply with counselor recommendations, & sign a release waiver for the Diversion Coordinator; and 10) Continue to attend mental health counseling as specified in agreement.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and out-of-county travel are granted at the discretion of  jail administration.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/ surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Receive counseling per Agent.
Complete fingerprints as required.
Pay court costs, surcharges, and supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hailey N. Heisler
